meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: grant of leave (批給許可) means a grant by the court of leave referred to in section 168Q of the Ordinance to any person in relation to a disqualification order.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Regulation applies in relation to a disqualification order made after the coming into operation of this Regulation and to a grant of leave, or any action taken by a court in consequence of which a disqualification order is varied or ceases to be in force, made or taken after that date, in relation to a disqualification order made before, on or after that date.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Officers of court to furnish particulars to Registrar

subsection.leadIn: The following officers of the court shall furnish to the Registrar the particulars specified in section 4(1)(a) and (b) in the form and manner there specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a disqualification order or grant of leave is made by the Court of First Instance, the Chief Judicial Clerk; (25 of 1998 s. 2)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: where a disqualification order is made by the Tribunal within the meaning of section 2 of the repealed Ordinance (within the meaning of section 168R(5) of the Ordinance) or the Market Misconduct Tribunal within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), the clerk to the Tribunal concerned, except that, where there is no clerk to the first-mentioned Tribunal, then the clerk to the second-mentioned Tribunal; (5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: if a disqualification order is made by the Competition Tribunal established by section 134 of the Competition Ordinance (Cap. 619), the Registrar of the Tribunal; (14 of 2012 s. 176 and E.R. 1 of 2013)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a disqualification order is made by the District Court, the Registrar of the District Court;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a disqualification order is made by a magistrate, the First Clerk.

subsection.content: Where a disqualification order is made by any of the courts mentioned in subsection (1) and subsequently any action is taken by a court in consequence of which that order is varied or ceases to be in force the officer of the first-mentioned court specified in subsection (1) shall furnish to the Registrar the particulars specified in section 4(1)(c) in the form and manner there specified.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Particulars to be furnished by officers of court

subsection.leadIn: The form in which the particulars are to be furnished is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that set out in Schedule 1 with such variations as circumstances require and the particulars contained therein are the particulars specified for that purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that set out in Schedule 2 with such variations as circumstances require when a grant of leave is made by the court, and the particulars contained therein are the particulars specified for that purpose;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that set out in Schedule 3 with such variations as circumstances require when any action is taken by a court in consequence of which a disqualification order is varied or ceases to be in force, and the particulars contained therein are the particulars specified for that purpose.

subsection.content: A prescribed officer of the court is to furnish the Registrar with the said particulars as soon as practically possible.

text.inline:
FORM D.O. 1COMPANIES (WINDING UP AND MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE(Cap. 32)Particulars of a disqualification order
Pursuant to section 168R

paragraph.content: I furnish the following particulars of a disqualification order made against a person as required by the Companies (Disqualification Orders) Regulation—

td.p: Section of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (C(WUMP)O), the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance (“SIDO”), the Securities and Futures Ordinance (“SFO”) or the Competition Ordinance (“ComO”) under which the order was made†—
Particulars of the person against whom the order was made—
Usual residential address at the date of the order (Note 4)
Hong Kong identity card No., if any (Note 5)
Number and issuing country of any passport (Note 6)
Address of registered or principal office in Hong Kong at the date of the order

tr.td: Date on which the order was made—

td.class: border_left_0.5 border_top_0.5 border_bottom_0.5 border_right_0.5 cellpadding_top_4 cellpadding_left_5

tr.td: Period of disqualification specified in the order—

paragraph.content: In the case of a Chinese individual, the Chinese characters for any forename or surname, if they are used by such individual, must be included.
“Forename” includes a Christian or given name.
“Surname” in the case of a person usually known by a title different from his surname, means that title.

Usual residential address must be given. “Residential address” does not include an address at a hotel unless the person to whom it relates is stated to have no other permanent address nor does it include a post office box number unless coupled with a residential address.
“Identity card” means an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177). If none, please state “None”.
If the Hong Kong identity card number of the person has been given, there is no need to give this information.

text.inline:
FORM D.O. 2COMPANIES (WINDING UP AND MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE(Cap. 32)Particulars of the grant of leave in relation to a disqualification order
Pursuant to section 168R

content.inline: I furnish the following particulars of the grant of leave in relation to a disqualification order as required by the Companies (Disqualification Orders) Regulation—

tr.td: Date of disqualification order in relation to which leave was granted—

td.class: border_left_0.5 border_top_0.5 border_bottom_0.5 border_right_0.5 cellpadding_top_4 cellpadding_left_5

td.p: Court which made the disqualification order in relation to which leave was granted—
Particulars of the person to whom leave was granted—
Hong Kong identity card No., if any (Note 4)
Number and issuing country of any passport (Note 5)

td.class: border_left_0.5 cellpadding_left_5 border_bottom_0.5 cellpadding_bottom_4 cellpadding_right_5 valign_bottom

td.p: If the name in which the disqualification order was made was different from that at item (3), the name in which that order was made—
Hong Kong identity card No., if any (Note 4)
Number and issuing country of any passport (Note 5)

Name of company in respect of which leave was granted, or in the case of leave to promote or form a company, the proposed name of the company where it is available, or if not, a brief description of the activities of the company—

td.class: border_top_0.5 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5 leaders__ cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5 valigN_bottom
cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5 leaders__ border_bottom_0.5 border_right_0.5 border_left_0.5

td.inline: Date on which leave was granted—

td.class: border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5 border_bottom_0.5 border_top_0.5 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_4

td.p: Activity for which leave was granted†——

td.class: cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_2 cellpadding_bottom_2 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5 border_top_0.5 border_bottom_0.5
cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_2 cellpadding_bottom_2 border_bottom_0.5 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5
cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_2 cellpadding_bottom_2 border_bottom_0.5 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5
td.p: Directorship or other participation in management

td.class: cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_2 cellpadding_bottom_2 border_bottom_0.5 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5
cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_2 cellpadding_bottom_2 border_bottom_0.5 border_left_0.5 border_right_0.5 cellpadding_right_5
td.p: Receivership or management of the property of the company

paragraph.content: In the case of a Chinese individual, the Chinese characters for any forename or surname, if they are used by such individual, must be included.
“Forename” includes a Christian or given name.
“Surname” in the case of a person usually known by a title different from his surname, means that title.
“Identity card” means an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177). If none, please state “None”.
If the Hong Kong identity card number of the person has been given, there is no need to give this information.

text.inline:
FORM D.O. 3COMPANIES (WINDING UP AND MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS) ORDINANCE(Cap. 32)Particulars of the variation or cessation of a disqualification order
Pursuant to section 168R

paragraph.content: I furnish the following particulars of the action taken by a court whereby a disqualification order made by this court under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance, the repealed Securities (Insider Dealing) Ordinance (Cap. 395), the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) or the Competition Ordinance (Cap. 619) was varied or ceased to be in force—

tr.td: Date on which the disqualification order was made by this court—

td.class: border_left_0.5 border_top_0.5 border_bottom_0.5 border_right_0.5 cellpadding_top_4 cellpadding_left_5

td.p: Particulars of the person against whom the disqualification order was made—
Hong Kong identity card No., if any (Note 4)
Number and issuing country of any passport (Note 5)

tr.td: Name of court by which action was taken whereby the disqualification order was varied or ceased to be in force—
order ceased to be in force
Date on which the new order was made—

td.class: border_left_0.5 border_top_0.5 border_bottom_0.5 border_right_0.5 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_top_4

paragraph.content: In the case of a Chinese individual, the Chinese characters for any forename or surname, if they are used by such individual, must be included.
“Forename” includes a Christian or given name.
“Surname” in the case of a person usually known by a title different from his surname, means that title.
“Identity card” means an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177). If none, please state “None”.
If the Hong Kong identity card number of the person has been given, there is no need to give this information.
